text: Two Justice Department lawyers say their superiors took marching orders from the White House in politically sensitive matters, including the Stone case. They're scheduled to talk to a House committee on Wednesday.
Tuesday's Primaries: Here Are The Races To Watch
Why Reopening Isn't Enough To Save The Economy
For Portland, Ore., Woman, Home These Days Is Where She Parks Her Minivan
House Democrats press the leaders of federal agencies for details on whether President Trump has stymied health experts from taking more effective action to stem the spread of the coronavirus.
A report on the impact of the novel coronavirus on the children of South Asia pays special note to reports of adolescent suicide — and looks at preventive measures.
Nationwide protests have opened the door for a conversation around how these systems should be used by police, amid growing evidence of gender and racial bias baked into the algorithms.
IBM Abandons Facial Recognition Products, Condemns Racially Biased Surveillance
Amazon Halts Police Use Of Its Facial Recognition Technology
"Rayshard Brooks wasn't just running from the police. He was running from a system that makes slaves out of people," the pastor says. Brooks was fatally shot by police in Atlanta.
The board cited Marge Schott's "record of racism and bigotry" in its decision. The late philanthropist and Cincinnati Reds owner was reviled for using racial and ethnic slurs and praising Hitler.
While the president says he authorized the federal government to prosecute those who deface and destroy statues on federal land, the government already had that power thanks to a 2003 law.
Former President Barack Obama tells supporters they need to do more to ensure a Joe Biden win in the 2020 presidential race.
Since receiving a landmark treatment with the gene-editing tool CRISPR, a sickle cell patient has the strength to care for herself and her children — while navigating the pandemic.

The museum has tightened its acquisition policies and is working to return potentially looted objects. Early acquisitions reflected a lack of expertise and lack of policy, its chief curator tells NPR.
Governments and drug companies agree: We need to develop a vaccine for COVID-19. But their motives for developing a vaccine are different. And that will have a big effect on the vaccine's price.
Get the latest on coronavirus-related restrictions in the Southern states — from Texas to Virginia, from Oklahoma to Florida, Georgia and more — plus D.C. and Puerto Rico.

President Trump continues on the campaign trail with stops in Arizona to survey the border wall with Mexico and rally a group of student supporters.

2020 Electoral Map Ratings: Biden Has An Edge Over Trump, With 5 Months To Go
Company officials announces production of the Segway PT will stop on July 15. The vehicle is popular among law enforcement and tourists, but falls short of its inventor's revolutionary goals.

Our famous summer reader poll is back, and this year, we're thinking about all the parents and caregivers stuck inside, reading to restless little ones. So tell us all about your favorite kids' books!
Summer Reader Poll 2020: Meet Our Esteemed Panelists!
John Sargent, CEO of Macmillan — one of the Big Five book publishing houses — has stepped back from day-to-day operations, after five employees organized an industry-wide protest against racism.
The city's deputy mayor said the banner was removed because he received complaints that it was offensive to residents.

Award-winning actress Tracee Ellis Ross talks about pushing back against Black stereotypes on and off-screen, pursuing success at any age and sharing her singing with her mother, music legend Diana Ross.
For Susan Burton, decades of disordered eating was about power. "As long as I was bingeing, I didn't have to think. I didn't have to think about any loss or pain or wanting or yearning."
Author Kristin Kobes Du Mez says: "It seemed like evangelicals had betrayed their values. But if you look at this longer history of evangelical masculinity and militarism ... this wasn't a betrayal."
